title: Magnetic fields - acceleration of conducting bar

content.question: Which of the following correctly describes the acceleration of the bar and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: The acceleration is zero because the resistor is not in the magnetic field.
The acceleration is zero because the magnetic force creates a charge separation across the ends of the bar but does not oppose the motion of the bar.

The acceleration is nonzero because there will be a current in the bar due to the induced <math alttext="e m f" overflow="scroll"><mtext>emf</mtext></math> and the magnetic field will exert a force on the current-carrying bar.
The acceleration is nonzero because the electric field created by the charge separation in the bar will exert a force on the bar.

content.answer: The acceleration is nonzero because there will be a current in the bar due to the induced <math alttext="e m f" overflow="scroll"><mtext>emf</mtext></math> and the magnetic field will exert a force on the current-carrying bar.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
